properties.description: Anslyn Estate – $775,000 Location: Windwardside, Saba, Caribbean Netherlands Property Size: 1600 m² | Expansive multi-unit estate | Lush tropical gardens | Multiple residences Property Overview Embrace the timeless charm of Saba at Anslyn Estate, a hillside sanctuary that blends traditional island living with modern versatility. Set just steps from Windwardside village yet cocooned in privacy, this unique property features a main residence, a fully self-contained guest cottage, and an adaptable third unit currently used as a gym. Perfect for peaceful island living, remote work, or a boutique hospitality venture, Anslyn Estate offers panoramic views of Windwardside and the Caribbean Sea in a lush, garden-filled setting. Steeped in history, the estate was lovingly built by Arthur Anslyn, a renowned Saban sea captain and diver who played a pivotal role in local history. Surrounded in the past by farmland, it was once a community hub for fresh eggs and fruit — a tradition reflected today in its extraordinary collection of fruit-bearing trees. Key Features Main House - 3 bedrooms and 1 full bathroom - Equipped kitchen with spacious living and dining rooms - Outdoor kitchen, two storage lofts, and covered porch - Large outdoor area plus separate shed with laundry facilities Guest Cottage - Independent residence with bedroom, bathroom, kitchenette, and small living area - Covered porch and private outdoor space - Separate entrance and utility connections - Ideal for guests, long-term rental, or home office use Additional Units - Detached, climate-controlled building currently a gym (also suited for office or studio) - Large outdoor shed for gardening tools - Smaller storage shed for equipment and supplies Garden & Surroundings - Immersed in a lush tropical landscape with an exceptional variety of fruit trees: Avocado, Mango, Grapefruit, Breadfruit, Soursop, Orange, Lemon, Pomegranate, Red Custard Apple, Guava, Banana, Guinip, Papaya, Coffee, and Pineapple - Expansive grounds offering both beauty and functionality Architectural Details - Red zinc roof, white walls, storm shutters, and traditional high-pitched ceilings - Open-concept living area with classic Saban charm Unique Opportunity Anslyn Estate is more than a property — it is a piece of Saba’s living history, enriched by the legacy of Arthur Anslyn and the vibrant gardens that surround it. properties.title: Quill Land
properties.description: Quill Land - Price Upon Request Location: Oranjestad, St. Eustatius (Statia) Property Size: 185 acres (748,987.9 m²) Price Reduction: Reduced by $7M! Property Overview: This expansive and pristine Quill Land, located in the Whitewall area at the base of Quill Mountain, offers an extraordinary opportunity for multiple developments on the island of St. Eustatius (Statia). Spanning an impressive 185 acres, this tropical paradise boasts stunning ocean views and natural beauty, making it an ideal location for large-scale projects. Key Features: - Development Potential: - The property comes with detailed plans for hotels, houses, and other developments, offering a head start on creating a variety of projects. - Its vast size and prime location provide endless possibilities for both commercial and residential development. - Scenic Views: - Surrounded by breathtaking ocean and hillside views, the land is a natural haven for anyone looking to create a unique living or business environment in the Caribbean. - Ideal Location: - Situated at the base of Quill Mountain, the property is located on Statia, a friendly and safe island rich in history, hiking trails, diving spots, parks, and incredible scenic views. Location Highlights: - Close to St. Maarten: - Statia is just a 15-minute flight away from St. Maarten, making it easily accessible for both travelers and residents. - Part of the Netherlands: - Since 2010, Statia has been a municipality of the Netherlands, offering the benefits of Dutch governance. English is the main language, and the US dollar is the local currency, ensuring convenience for international investors. Natural Beauty & Rich History: - Tropical Paradise: - Enjoy year-round stable temperatures both on land and underwater, making this property ideal for various types of developments or a personal retreat in the heart of the Caribbean.
